snippet: The Federal Trade Commission said LifeLock, an identity protection service, failed to deliver on promises it would guard personal data and inform users when their information was breached.
abstract: The Federal Trade Commission said LifeLock, an identity protection service, failed to deliver on promises it would guard personal data and inform users when their information was breached.

headline.main: LifeLock Agrees to Pay $100 Million Fine in Settlement With F.T.C.
headline.print_headline: LifeLock Will Pay $100 Million to Settle Charges With the F.T.C.
